private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks: A E I O
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the stacks so that A is on top of B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, and O is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks: F L B H G D J N M K C etc.
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the stacks so that A is on top of B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, and O is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem that coordinates the two agents to transform the initial block configuration into the specified goal configuration using the FastDownward planner.

public_information: Blocks present: F A L B E H I G D J N M K C O

Initial placements: F is on the table, A is on the table, L is on top of A, B is on the table, E is on top of L, H is on top of F, I is on top of H, G is on top of I, D is on the table, J is on top of E, N is on top of D, M is on top of G, K is on top of B, C is on top of J, O is on top of C
Only the top block of any stack can be moved at any time
Each agent can move at most one block at a time
One agent can only move vowel blocks and the other can only move consonant blocks
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, O on the table

analysis.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. Use the public information and your private information to analyze which vowel blocks you can legally move given the top-of-stack constraint. Provide a structured summary listing: current stacks with top blocks, which vowel blocks are immediately movable, any blocking relationships that prevent vowel moves, and a short sequence of recommended safe moves in plain text. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on accurate state reporting and recommended action sequences from the perspective of the vowel-only mover.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have access to the public environment information and your private knowledge that you can only move vowels (A E I O) and only top blocks and only one at a time. Produce a concise structured summary listing current top blocks, which vowels are movable now, which vowels are blocked and by which blocks, and short suggested move steps that you could perform without assuming actions by the other agent.

analysis.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. Use the public information and your private information to analyze which consonant blocks you can legally move given the top-of-stack constraint. Provide a structured summary listing: current stacks with top blocks, which consonant blocks are immediately movable, any blocking relationships that prevent consonant moves, and a short sequence of recommended safe moves in plain text. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on accurate state reporting and recommended action sequences from the perspective of the consonant-only mover.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have access to the public environment information and your private knowledge that you can only move consonants and only top blocks and only one at a time. Produce a concise structured summary listing current top blocks, which consonants are movable now, which consonants are blocked and by which blocks, and short suggested move steps that you could perform without assuming actions by the other agent.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator. Your task is to integrate the two agents' analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward planner. Model two distinct agents by keeping their actions separate and explicitly named (for example move-vowel and move-consonant or equivalent). Ensure the domain encodes: blocks, table, on/clear predicates, the top-only move restriction, single-block-per-action restriction, and the agent-specific mover restrictions (vowel-only and consonant-only). Ensure the problem encodes the initial stack configuration exactly as provided and the goal stack chain. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownward compatibility in syntax and typing.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You have the following public information: Blocks and their initial placements and the global goal. You also have these two agents' structured analyses: vowel agent analysis: {vowel_analysis} and consonant agent analysis: {consonant_analysis}. Integrate these inputs, resolve any naming or blocking ambiguities, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models two agents with distinct move actions and enforces vowels-only and consonants-only move constraints. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
